trans-unit.source: register_taxonomies — Registers the taxonomies for the post type.
remove_hooks — Removes the future post hook action for the post type.
remove_rewrite_rules — Removes any rewrite rules, permastructs, and rules for the post type.
remove_supports — Removes the features support for the post type.
set_props — Sets post type properties.
unregister_meta_boxes — Unregisters the post type meta box if a custom callback was specified.
unregister_taxonomies — Removes the post type from all taxonomies.
__construct — Constructor.
_page_rows — Given a top level page ID, display the nested hierarchy of sub-pages together with paging support
categories_dropdown — Displays a categories drop-down for filtering on the Posts list table.
column_author — Handles the post author column output.
column_cb — Handles the checkbox column output.
column_comments — Handles the comments column output.
column_date — Handles the post date column output.
column_default — Handles the default column output.
column_title — Handles the title column output.
formats_dropdown — Displays a formats drop-down for filtering items.
get_default_primary_column_name — Gets the name of the default primary column.
get_edit_link — Helper to create links to edit.php with params.
handle_row_actions — Generates and displays row action links.
inline_edit — Outputs the hidden row displayed when inline editing
is_base_request — Determine if the current view is the "All" view.
set_hierarchical_display — Sets whether the table layout should be hierarchical or not.

WP_Privacy_Policy_Content class.
__construct — Constructor
_policy_page_updated — Update the cached policy info when the policy page is updated.
add — Add content to the postbox shown when editing the privacy policy.
add_suggested_content — Add the suggested privacy policy text to the policy postbox.
get_default_content — Return the default suggested privacy policy content.
get_suggested_policy_text — Check for updated, added or removed privacy policy information from plugins.
notice — Add a notice with a link to the guide when editing the privacy policy page.
policy_text_changed_notice — Output a warning when some privacy info has changed.
privacy_policy_guide — Output the privacy policy guide together with content from the theme and plugins.
text_change_check — Quick check if any privacy info has changed.
WP_Privacy_Requests_Table class.
column_cb — Checkbox column.
column_default — Default column handler.
column_email — Actions column. Overridden by children.
column_next_steps — Next steps column. Overridden by children.
column_status — Status column.
embed_scripts — Embed scripts used to perform actions. Overridden by children.
get_bulk_actions — Get bulk actions.
get_columns — Get columns to show in the list table.

get_sortable_columns — Get a list of sortable columns.
get_timestamp_as_date — Convert timestamp for display.
get_views — Get an associative array ( id => link ) with the list of views available on this table.
prepare_items — Prepare items to output.
process_bulk_action — Process bulk actions.
single_row — Generates content for a single row of the table,
__call — Make private/protected methods readable for backward compatibility.
__construct — Constructor.
__get — Make private properties readable for backward compatibility.
__isset — Make private properties checkable for backward compatibility.
__unset — Make private properties settable for backwards compatibility.
fill_query_vars — Fills in the query variables, which do not exist within the parameter.
generate_postdata — Generate post data.
get — Retrieve query variable.
get_posts — Retrieves an array of posts based on query variables.
get_queried_object — Retrieve queried object.
get_queried_object_id — Retrieve ID of the current queried object.
get_search_stopwords — Retrieve stopwords used when parsing search terms.
have_comments — Whether there are more comments available.
have_posts — Determines whether there are more posts available in the loop.
init — Initiates object properties and sets default values.
init_query_flags — Resets query flags to false.
is_404 — Is the query a 404 (returns no results)?
is_archive — Is the query for an existing archive page?
is_attachment — Is the query for an existing attachment page?
is_author — Is the query for an existing author archive page?
is_category — Is the query for an existing category archive page?
is_comment_feed — Is the query for a comments feed?
is_comments_popup — Whether the current URL is within the comments popup window. — deprecated
is_date — Is the query for an existing date archive?
is_day — Is the query for an existing day archive?
is_embed — Is the query for an embedded post?
is_feed — Is the query for a feed?
is_front_page — Is the query for the front page of the site?
is_home — Is the query for the blog homepage?
is_main_query — Is the query the main query?
is_month — Is the query for an existing month archive?
is_page — Is the query for an existing single page?
is_paged — Is the query for paged result and not for the first page?
is_post_type_archive — Is the query for an existing post type archive page?
is_preview — Is the query for a post or page preview?
is_privacy_policy — Is the query for the Privacy Policy page?
is_robots — Is the query for the robots file?
is_search — Is the query for a search?
is_single — Is the query for an existing single post?
is_singular — Is the query for an existing single post of any post type (post, attachment, page, custom post types)?
is_tag — Is the query for an existing tag archive page?
is_tax — Is the query for an existing custom taxonomy archive page?
is_time — Is the query for a specific time?
is_trackback — Is the query for a trackback endpoint call?
is_year — Is the query for an existing year archive?
lazyload_comment_meta — Lazyload comment meta for comments in the loop. — deprecated
lazyload_term_meta — Lazyload term meta for posts in the loop. — deprecated
next_comment — Iterate current comment index and return WP_Comment object.
next_post — Set up the next post and iterate current post index.
parse_order — Parse an 'order' query variable and cast it to ASC or DESC as necessary.
parse_orderby — Converts the given orderby alias (if allowed) to a properly-prefixed value.
parse_query — Parse a query string and set query type booleans.
parse_query_vars — Reparse the query vars.
parse_search — Generates SQL for the WHERE clause based on passed search terms.
parse_search_order — Generates SQL for the ORDER BY condition based on passed search terms.
parse_search_terms — Check if the terms are suitable for searching.
parse_tax_query — Parses various taxonomy related query vars.
query — Sets up the WordPress query by parsing query string.
reset_postdata — After looping through a nested query, this function restores the $post global to the current post in this query.
rewind_comments — Rewind the comments, resets the comment index and comment to first.
rewind_posts — Rewind the posts and reset post index.
set — Set query variable.
set_404 — Sets the 404 property and saves whether query is feed.
set_found_posts — Set up the amount of found posts and the number of pages (if limit clause was used) for the current query.
setup_postdata — Set up global post data.
the_comment — Sets up the current comment.
the_post — Sets up the current post.
__construct — WP_Recovery_Mode constructor.
clean_expired_keys — Cleans any recovery mode keys that have expired according to the link TTL.
exit_recovery_mode — Ends the current recovery mode session.
get_email_rate_limit — Gets the rate limit between sending new recovery mode email links.
get_extension_for_error — Gets the extension that the error occurred in.
get_link_ttl — Gets the number of seconds the recovery mode link is valid for.
get_session_id — Gets the recovery mode session ID.
handle_cookie — Handles checking for the recovery mode cookie and validating it.
handle_error — Handles a fatal error occurring.
handle_exit_recovery_mode — Handles a request to exit Recovery Mode.
initialize — Initialize recovery mode for the current request.
is_active — Checks whether recovery mode is active.
is_initialized — Checks whether recovery mode has been initialized.
is_network_plugin — Checks whether the given extension a network activated plugin.
redirect_protected — Redirects the current request to allow recovering multiple errors in one go.
store_error — Stores the given error so that the extension causing it is paused.
clear_cookie — Clears the recovery mode cookie.
generate_cookie — Generates the recovery mode cookie value.
get_session_id_from_cookie — Gets the session identifier from the cookie.
is_cookie_set — Checks whether the recovery mode cookie is set.
parse_cookie — Parses the cookie into its four parts.
recovery_mode_hash — Gets a form of `wp_hash()` specific to Recovery Mode.
set_cookie — Sets the recovery mode cookie.
validate_cookie — Validates the recovery mode cookie.
__construct — WP_Recovery_Mode_Email_Service constructor.
clear_rate_limit — Clears the rate limit, allowing a new recovery mode email to be sent immediately.
get_cause — Gets the description indicating the possible cause for the error.
get_recovery_mode_email_address — Gets the email address to send the recovery mode link to.
maybe_send_recovery_mode_email — Sends the recovery mode email if the rate limit has not been sent.
send_recovery_mode_email — Sends the Recovery Mode email to the site admin email address.
clean_expired_keys — Removes expired recovery mode keys.
generate_and_store_recovery_mode_key — Creates a recovery mode key.
generate_recovery_mode_token — Creates a recovery mode token.
get_keys — Gets the recovery key records.
remove_key — Removes a used recovery key.
update_keys — Updates the recovery key records.
validate_recovery_mode_key — Verifies if the recovery mode key is correct.
__construct — WP_Recovery_Mode_Link_Service constructor.
generate_url — Generates a URL to begin recovery mode.

handle_begin_link — Enters recovery mode when the user hits wp-login.php with a valid recovery mode link.

WP_Tax_Query is a helper that allows primary query classes, such as WP_Query, to filter their results by object metadata, by generating JOIN and WHERE subclauses to be attached to the primary SQL query string.

get_settings — Retrieves the settings for all instances of the widget class.
is_preview — Determines whether the current request is inside the Customizer preview.
save_settings — Saves the settings for all instances of the widget class.
update — Updates a particular instance of a widget.
update_callback — Handles changed settings (Do NOT override).
widget — Echoes the widget content.
WP_Widget — PHP4 constructor.
__construct — Sets up a new Archives widget instance.
form — Outputs the settings form for the Archives widget.
update — Handles updating settings for the current Archives widget instance.
widget — Outputs the content for the current Archives widget instance.
active_callback — Whether the current sidebar is rendered on the page.
render_content — Renders the control's content.
to_json — Refreshes the parameters passed to the JavaScript via JSON.
__construct — Sets up a new Calendar widget instance.
form — Outputs the settings form for the Calendar widget.
update — Handles updating settings for the current Calendar widget instance.
widget — Outputs the content for the current Calendar widget instance.
__construct — Sets up a new Categories widget instance.
form — Outputs the settings form for the Categories widget.
update — Handles updating settings for the current Categories widget instance.
widget — Outputs the content for the current Categories widget instance.
__construct — Sets up a new Custom HTML widget instance.
_filter_gallery_shortcode_attrs — Filter gallery shortcode attributes.
_register_one — Add hooks for enqueueing assets when registering all widget instances of this widget class.
add_help_text — Add help text to widgets admin screen.
enqueue_admin_scripts — Loads the required scripts and styles for the widget control.
form — Outputs the Custom HTML widget settings form.
render_control_template_scripts — Render form template scripts.
update — Handles updating settings for the current Custom HTML widget instance.
widget — Outputs the content for the current Custom HTML widget instance.
__construct — PHP5 constructor.
_register_widgets — Serves as a utility method for adding widgets to the registered widgets global.
hash_object — Hashes an object, doing fallback of `spl_object_hash()` if not available.
register — Registers a widget subclass.
unregister — Un-registers a widget subclass.
WP_Widget_Factory — PHP4 constructor.
active_callback — Whether the current widget is rendered on the page.
render_content — Override render_content to be no-op since content is exported via to_json for deferred embedding.
to_json — Gather control params for exporting to JavaScript.
__construct — Sets up a new Links widget instance.
form — Outputs the settings form for the Links widget.
update — Handles updating settings for the current Links widget instance.
widget — Outputs the content for the current Links widget instance.
__construct — Constructor.
_register — Add hooks while registering all widget instances of this widget class.
_register_one — Add hooks while registering all widget instances of this widget class.
display_media_state — Filters the default media display states for items in the Media list table.
enqueue_admin_scripts — Loads the required scripts and styles for the widget control.
enqueue_preview_scripts — Enqueue preview scripts.
form — Outputs the settings update form.
get_instance_schema — Get schema for properties of a widget instance (item).
has_content — Whether the widget has content to show.
is_attachment_with_mime_type — Determine if the supplied attachment is for a valid attachment post with the specified MIME type.
render_control_template_scripts — Render form template scripts.
render_media — Render the media on the frontend.
sanitize_token_list — Sanitize a token list string, such as used in HTML rel and class attributes.
update — Sanitizes the widget form values as they are saved.
widget — Displays the widget on the front-end.
